definitions.definition: The property of indicating the point in time at which an action or state of being occurs or exists.
examples: Dyirbal verbs are not inflected for tense .

definitions.definition: An inflected form of a verb that indicates tense .
examples: English only has a past tense and a non-past tense ; it has no future tense .

definitions.definition: A verb form or construction indicating a combination of tense , aspect , and mood .
examples: The "simple present" tense in English can have several meanings.
The Spanish teacher told the student to use the imperfect tense instead of the preterite tense .

main_definition: ( linguistics , uncountable ) The property of indicating the point in time at which an action or state of being occurs or exists.
secondary_definitions: ( linguistics , grammar , countable ) An inflected form of a verb that indicates tense .
( grammar , countable , proscribed ) A grammatical aspect .
( grammar , countable , proscribed ) A verb form or construction indicating a combination of tense , aspect , and mood .
